result.execSummary:
The defendant Emilio Christopher Fregoso was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges by 01-12-17 or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept. Cash bail applied.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Emilio Christopher Fregoso

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Emilio Christopher Fregoso in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve EIGHT (8) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for EIGHT (8) days time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges by 01-12-2017 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Services Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Emilio Christopher Fregoso in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State reports that Defendant has picked up new charges.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Court ordered matter adjourned for Sentencing to Br. 33.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

15RM056097  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
12-19-2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Emilio Christopher Fregoso in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Emilio Christopher Fregoso in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Emilio Christopher Fregoso
Current: 7416 Harwood Ave, #232, Wauwatosa, WI 53213   (Effective: 12-16-2015)
Prior: 1726 N. 83rd Street, Wauwatosa, WI 53213
WCS Report.  Filed, sdg.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($200.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 200.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense reports that Defendant called his attorney this morning detailing numerous reasons for his absence.  Defense requests a brief adjournment in order to verify these reasons.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Emilio Christopher Fregoso in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Defendant has not been in compliance with the agreement (POSITIVE tests and MISSED appointments).  State was referred a new charge but HAS NOT issued formal charges yet.  If defense is compliant with this matter the other charge will not be issued.  Review hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Report. Filed, sdg.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.

  All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Emilio Christopher Fregoso in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 310 Safety Building on 7/27/15 @ 1:30 pm
